overview: After completion of this subject, students will have the knowledge and skill to insert and clean a transoesophageal echocardiography (TOE) probe and how to perform a focused TOE examination, interpret and write a structured report on the assessment of haemodynamic state and cardiac pathology using two dimensional and colour flow Doppler. Students will perform, interpret, write a report and submit a log-book of at least 15 focused TOE studies on simulators and/or patients with a wide range of pathology and interpret and report an additional 10 online focused TOE studies.
ilo: Comprehensively understand the indications, uses and limitations of transoesophageal echocardiography (TOE) in assessment of cardiac pathology and haemodynamic state
Safely insert and clean a transoesophageal echocardiography (TOE) probe
Perform, interpret and write a structured report of the haemodynamic state and cardiac pathology using focused TOE
Evaluate the requirements for training, competence, and certification of breast ultrasound
generic_skills: Improved procedural skills for students who select a practical subject
Improved written skills and problem-solving skills

Prerequisites.content: Note: these can be taken concurrently (at the same time)

Inherent requirements (core participatio.content: Adequate visual acuity is required to perform and interpret clinical ultrasound. A  student is expected to demonstrate: Sufficient visual acuity to perform the required range of skills, including reading ultrasound monitors across a bed and interpreting ultrasound images on standard commercially available ultrasound machines.

Gross and fine motor skills are required in performing clinical ultrasound. A student is expected to demonstrate adequate gross and fine motor skills to perform focused ultrasound whilst avoiding injury to patients, colleagues and self.

assessment.brief: multiple-choice questions following each tutorial (25 MCQ)
Interpretation of 10 online case studies assessed by structured MCQ pertaining to each case (50 MCQ)
Complete a logbook of 15 focused ultrasound studies on either patients or simulators
assessment.hurdle: Student must submit a logbook of 15 focused ultrasound studies on either patients or simulators to pass this subject.
